devdoc.author: Brendan Asselstine

computeAddress(address,uint256).details: The contract will not exist yet, so the Loot Box address will have no code.

returns._0: The address of the Loot Box.

constructor.details: Creates a new LootBox instance and an associated minimal proxy.

executeCalls(address,uint256,(address,ui.details: The Loot Box will be counterfactually created, calls executed, then the contract destroyed.

params.calls: The array of call structs that define that target, amount of ether, and data.

returns._0: The array of call return values.

plunder(address,uint256,address[],(addre.details: A Loot Box contract will be counterfactually created, tokens transferred to the ERC721 owner, then destroyed.

params.erc1155s: An array of struct defining ERC1155 tokens that should be transferred
params.erc20s: An array of ERC20 tokens whose entire balance should be transferred
params.erc721s: An array of structs defining ERC721 tokens that should be transferred

devdoc.title: Allows users to plunder an address associated with an ERC721

Executed(address,uint256,address).notice: Emitted when a Loot Box is executed

Plundered(address,uint256,address).notice: Emitted when a Loot Box is plundered

computeAddress(address,uint256).notice: Computes the Loot Box address for a given ERC721 token.

executeCalls(address,uint256,(address,ui.notice: Allows the owner of an ERC721 to execute abitrary calls on behalf of the associated Loot Box.

plunder(address,uint256,address[],(addre.notice: Allows anyone to transfer all given tokens in a Loot Box to the associated ERC721 owner.

userdoc.notice: Counterfactually instantiates a "Loot Box" at an address unique to an ERC721 token.  The address for an ERC721 token can be computed and later plundered by transferring token balances to the ERC721 owner.
